alert.note: Alert for Bexar; Caldwell; Comal; Guadalupe; Hays (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 02 at 7:27PM CST by NWS Austin-San Antonio
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 1030 PM CST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Texas, including the following counties, Bexar, Caldwell, Comal, Guadalupe and Hays. * WHEN...Until 1030 PM CST. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 727 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 0.5 and 1.5 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.5 to 1 inch are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... San Antonio, New Braunfels, San Marcos, Schertz, Kyle, Cibolo, Universal City, Live Oak, Selma, Wimberley, Canyon Lake Dam, Randolph AFB, Canyon Lake, Bulverde, Garden Ridge, Martindale, Santa Clara, Staples, Zorn and Geronimo. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
